title: Road teams favored in #BeatBrian
text:
Road teams favored in #BeatBrian Brian Achatz shares his football picks for week eight of the high school season. Ben Twingley/btwingley@pnj.com BRIAN ACHATZ, bachatz@pnj.com 5:05 p.m. CDT October 16, 2015 Achatz (Photo: Ben Twingley) 
In case anyone forgot, I went undefeated last week in #BeatBrian. 
I'm hoping to keep that momentum going, but there are 71 participants this week who are aiming to thwart my success. 
This Friday, we're back to district play and we've chosen from a slate of eight games. 
The spiciest items on the menu are likely Tate at Escambia and Navarre at Milton. 
Escambia needs a district win to keep the likelihood of its playoff hopes alive. 
For Milton, the Panthers are looking to turn the tables in the district after being stunned by Gulf Breeze, but they'll face the Navarre Raiders, who are off to the best start in program history. 
So, I hope you dialed up the right picks if you participated this week. If you didn't sign up, make sure to log on to www.pnj.com/BeatBrian next week to sign up for the best contest in town. 
Now, let's get down to picking: 
Tate at Escambia: This game is a rematch of a Week 11 thriller from last season in which Tate won 27-24. Though they don't have home field advantage, the Aggies hold the momentum of a two-game win streak. I see this one as an intense, defensive struggle. But I think Tate's more balanced offense provides the edge on Friday night. 
Tate over Escambia 
Navarre at Milton: It would be quite a story if Milton earned it's first District 2-6A win of the season over the undefeated Navarre Raiders. However, I think Navarre is simply too good to let this one go. Milton's offense holds more balance but the Panthers will face one of the most aggressive defenses in the area. 
Navarre over Milton 
Arnold at PHS: I'm convinced the Tigers had a more productive bye week than any team thus far. I think they'll come out hot as the Tigers play host to District 1-5A foe Arnold. If PHS can contain Arnold QB Cody Saunders, they should have this one locked up. 
PHS over Arnold 
West Florida at Bay: Bay's record (7-0, 1-0) and ranking (No. 7 in Class 5A) say it all. Bay relies heavily on its rushing attack, but I think the Tornadoes will run into the hardest hitting team they've seen yet. Watch for the Jags receivers to go off in this one. 
West Florida over Bay 
Pine Forest at Washington: Here's Pine Forest's chance to take the district by the horns. I see the Eagles coming off their bye and showing massive offense. 
Pine Forest over Washington 
Gulf Breeze at Pace: This one comes down to Gulf Breeze's pass vs. Pace's run. Though Pace lost last week, I think the Patriots showed big strides of improvement. 
Pace over Gulf Breeze 
Taylor County at Catholic: The Crusaders have a great opportunity here. With home-field and the upper hand in the district, the Crusaders can lock up 1-3A with a win. I see Abram Smiley running his way to Catholic's goal. 
Catholic over Taylor County 
Northview at Jay: This one could be a classic 1-1A rivalry shootout. Northview has shown more defensive consistency this year, and that will be key as the Chiefs head to Jay. 
Northview over Jay Carl Madison, former Pine Forest High School football coach from 1986-88, tosses the coin Friday before a homecoming game against the Escambia Gators. Pine Forest celebrated their 40th anniversary with special appearances from alumni. The Eagles beat the Gators 21-17.
